name: Hotel La Cupula

reviews.title: Almost perfect except for early morning noise
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Cupula for three nights in Sep 2012. We LOVED the hotel. The room was great, sufficient enough space, nice hot shower, comfortable bed etc.
We cooked in the delightful kitchen most days. They provide tea, coffee and milk for you which is nice. It was also a great kitchen to cook and look out onto the garden. Such a beautiful setting.
reviews.title: Great views, ambience and welcome
Great value and beautiful setting
reviews.text: We also ate in the hotel restaurant which was good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My ONLY critiscm was that every morning we were awoken at around 6.30 - 7am by strange noises coming from above. I can only describe them as shuffling / banging repetitively. Not loud, but loud enough that you could hear it and it woke us up.
reviews.title: Best stay in Bolivia
One of the best in Bolivia
reviews.text: I'm not sure if it was the cleaners / restaurant staff getting up and getting prepared for the day, but it was sooo annoying to be woken from such a nice sleep at an earlier hour than planned.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gorgeous setting, brilliant owner, incredible value, just perfect.
reviews.title: Possibly the best place i've ever stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in May 2006. Quite pricey for the area but the first time we'd treated ourselves in nearly 3 months in south america. We took the honey moon suite for £18 a night. The restaurant is nice too, and the book exchange was well stocked.
reviews.title: Beautiful location and rooms
*Beautiful & perfectly located*
reviews.text: easy walking distance of the town centre, the lake shore where the fish n chip shops are (the fat lady at the end christened me Head Of Skin) and the church up on the hill.
The hotel provides heaters for the rooms in the evening, it can get quite chilly at that altitude.
reviews.title: Cosy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at La Cupula in April 2012 and were very impressed.
reviews.title: Best value for money of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice spot on the hill overlooking town and lake. Great gardens to chill out in with hammocks and deck chairs. Rooms clean and comfy beds, heater in room, it can get pretty chilly at night here. Stayed in two different rooms, the second was nicer. There are a lot of different rooms here so some seem better than others..Nice staff..ate breakfast once in restaurant i"d say ok but we went down town. For $30 I think this is great value and a really good choice and Copacabana is a great place to visit for a few days.
reviews.title: nice spot...
Best place in copocabana
reviews.text: After a few nights in la Paz this place was just what we needed. As it was a public holiday we weren't able to secure las olas but instead managed to book this place through a travel agent in la Paz. Turns out its the same German owner who owns the place. This place is only 5 minutes walk from the bus drop off. We had a double room and it was by far the best place we have stayed in in Bolivia. The room was perfect and we even got given a small heater. The showers were hot and just outside we're some hammocks to chill in the sun. The views are spectacular too. We ended up eating at the hotel 2 nights in a row as the food was excellent. Ask reception for the hot spa as its an awesome way to see the sunset. The spa is located outside overlooking the bay. Very friendly German owner who was very helpful. Great place worth the 5 stars!

reviews.title: Sweet views and funky architecture
reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels in Bolivia and its easy to see why. Great location and views overlooking the lake, clean bathrooms with steaming hot showers, and spacious hang-out areas. The staff at the hotel is extremely friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at La Cupula. Only crib is that they should include breakfast at the price they charge.
In all honesty we only stayed here because we couldn't get in to Las Olas but straightaway we weren't disappointed.
reviews.title: Very good. Clean and affordable, with amazing views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really cool room with double bed on a raised level with a view out over the lake. Amazing to wake up to.
reviews.title: Relax, recharge, renew

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the cupula hotel and can highly recommend it! Okay, it's a bit of a walk from the center, but the rooms are nice, the staff fridndly and the restaurant fabulous! The owner is a very fridndly and hrlpful guy and made sure we could even hang out snd take showers fter we came back from isla del sol, before catching the night bus.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel a great restaurant

reviews.text: Although it can be tiring to walk up to after a long day out the views make it worthwhile. Overlooking Lake Titicaca with a nice garden with hammocks to chill out in. Rooms very nice and cleaned regularly.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Picked for the good reviews in Lonely Planet and on Trip Advisor and it deserves them all. The hostel sits on a hill overlooking the town and although this means a walk back from trips and shopping, it also means it is away from any unpleasant aromas (drains) that can be found in town. It is only a 5 minute walk into the centre or to the boat trips.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Copa

reviews.text: The hostel has gardens with seating areas that include deckchairs and colourful hammocks where guests can relax and read or just take in the views. There is also a small children’s play area.
reviews.title: Great place to relax and to have a good dinner

reviews.text: It is possible to organise a reservation in advance but these are only held until 2pm. You can also turn up after 2pm and ask if there are any vacancies, like I did. I stayed in two rooms over 4 nights. They were both ensuite with good views, both had seating areas with two chairs and a table and more importantly they had electric heaters. Hot water bottles and extra blankets are also available and were used when I stayed. The rooms were cleaned daily. The bathroom was also very clean and well furnished with a good (not electric) shower.
reviews.title: Excellent all-around

description: You are invited to enjoy our 17 cosy rooms and suites with high quality beds and absolutely hot showers all day. Each room counts with an electric heater (free use!).The hostel provides 5 spacious gardens (3000 m2) with great views over the lake, equiped with hammocks, deck chairs and stone tables. A cosy living room with an extensive DVD colection, cable TV, as well as a fully equiped kitchen with free tea and Coffee.
